website_summaries.verdict: In terms of functionality and features, this affordable potty training seat gives some pricier models a run for their money.
pros: Attaches securely to most modern seats and a nonskid edge helps keep it in place
Side grips give little ones an added sense of security and allows for hygienic handling
Contoured for comfort with an integrated splash guard for boys
Can be used with a deodorizing disk
cons: May be a bit too big for older, smaller toilet seats

customer_reviews.title: Potty training is not easy. I got one of those mini toilets on ...
customer_reviews.text: Potty training is not easy. I got one of those mini toilets on the ground and my daughter doesn't like to use it. She wants to be a big girl. So rather fight a needless battle I got one of these. We got a ikea hook on the wall to hang it on, so she can grab it, place it on the toilet and go. The grip is good so it doesn't move, it's easy for little hands to grab and it's easy to clean. And when she visits granparents its easy to pack up. Side note. When she first got the toilet she thought it was a hat. Toddlers are silly people.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Us
customer_reviews.text: We decided to try this one, having the most positive reviews, and we’re very satisfied. I’m buying another. We do have elongated seats at home but they’re oddly minimalist in nature & we really wanted something stable. We have used it at our relative’s house & I’m fairly certain she has a round seat, and we’ve used it in public on some odd shaped seats, and it’s fit every time, so far. No seat is perfect as far as I can tell, but this is certainly versatile in our experience
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat is much better than the cushioning ones my kid was using the past year. It's so easy to clean, no little hidden creases that store pee,it's all plastic. It does not seem to fit on the round toilet seats, I had to go buy the next size up for it to fit and snap in. You have to actually push down on the potty seat in the back for it to snap in the toilet seat but my 3 year old can do it with no problems. I like that it stands up for storage. My child had problems taking potty seats off a hook, it would always rip off the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany V.

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit seats less than 9 7/8 inches front to back on inner seat
customer_reviews.text: Received seat and went to set it up. This seat did not fit my toilet. Have standard round and seat does not fit on toilet seat. Loosely fits on bowl but is not steady. Inner rim of of munchkin is appox 9 7/8” from front to back and left to right is 8”. Most toilets will be wide enough from left to right but toilet seat must be equal to or great than 9 7/8 in for it to fit. Mine was 9 1/2 in and could not force it in to fit snuggly. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Kellen A. Park

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, allows urine to go between the toilet and this seat, and onto the ground!!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this for my 2 and half year old daughter. I wanted something that would go over our toilet so she felt secure and I wouldn’t have to hold her. Unfortunately, I was surely disappointed because she keeps peeing all over the front of it and it goes between the seat and onto our toilet and down the front of it. Im thinking about returning it because it’s such a inconvenience cleaning up urine all over the floor 4-6 times a day!! This would be perfect if it had a higher front to it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Not good for oval toilet
customer_reviews.text: Sits too far back on oval toilet. Got this for our almost-two-year-old son who is potty training. It sits too far back on our plastic oval slow close toilet seat for his legs to reach the stool. The quality seems good, easy to clean, great price, would probably work well for a round toilet or older kids with long legs, but I'm probably going to find something else to use. UPDATE: Figured out it fits better on the Mayfair brand slow close plastic toilet seat, so I swapped toilet seats in our house to make it work. A lot of effort for a simple product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Yes for girls, no for boys.
customer_reviews.text: Why have we been to the moon and why are we exploring the oceans when we haven’t figured out toilet seats for men and little boys?!? This seat is great! Clean lines, easy to clean, sits in toilet easily, and very travel friendly. BUT my son can’t use it because he would be able to do both actions at the same time if you catch my drift. The hole is too round instead of oval like it needs to be. I love most things munchkin so I really didn’t want to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great for our toddler
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was going potty on a small potty and was ready to use the regular toilet. This is a perfect fit for her (with the help of a stepping stool). Fits perfectly in our toilet. The handles on the side make her feel extra safe!! Due to the current situation, we have not tested it for travel. Update: bought for my parent's house since it's soo good.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Pee pee roulette for boys.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to clean, comfortable... but you better hope your little boy pees before he sits down to poop or it's game over, man. The "pee guard" does nothing, unless your little man is able to "point it down" himself. It barely covers my kiddo's "teskittles," let alone keep me from getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: Using with Ikea and Munchkin seats
customer_reviews.text: We have these on 2 different toilets. They didn't fit quite perfectly because of the toilet lid, but it is definitely functional. It makes me a little bit less stressed to have the potty seats up and away. It looks better than it being thrown on top of who knows what is on the side floor. Practically speaking, my kids can take them on and off if we just let the potty seat rims go over the hook (rather than try to thread them thru a little grove in the potty seat's back).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: Seat too short but functional
customer_reviews.text: I like this toilet seat. It fits all the toilets I’ve tried it with (a pretty large variety) and while it leaves a noticeable gap in the front of hotel toilets, it still works. My issue with this is that I wish the seat was longer. My toddler needs to sit pretty far forward or else she’s pooping onto the seat instead of the hole. But this also means sometimes her pee shoots out above the seat front and, of course, all over me. It’s not a bad product but really could use a slight longer design so toddlers can sit more comfortably and parents aren’t cleaning poo smears off the back and pee splash off their faces.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase if potty training a boy
customer_reviews.text: This product I was very unhappy with the quality of the plastic and make was completely fine however a little cup to protect urine from going all over the floor is most definitely not high enough so it absolutely covers nothing up for a boy while potty training!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Stillion

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and doesn’t contain pee
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t agree with the word “sturdy” to describe this seat. It pops out of place more often than not, and my son constantly falls off as a result. Also...the pee guard is nowhere near high enough. How was this not tested during the design process??? Unless posture and position are both perfect, the pee will go over the top of the guard and run down the toilet and onto the floor. Every. Single. Time. Great fun for me. I just love cleaning the toilet and floor multiple times a day!
customer_reviews.author: sarahnmnp

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the bathroom in my basement as the toilet is low enough for my daughter to be able to climb on it without stepping later or anything like that also the toilet book seat is small so this fit right in without slipping and sliding. Very happy with my purchase it seems very comfortable as I can’t physically try it myself lol but my daughter doesn’t seem to mind it. The plastic is great quality and the color green is cute
customer_reviews.author: JRL

customer_reviews.title: UNSTABLE - SLIPS and SLIDES ALL OVER THE TOILET SEAT
customer_reviews.text: This seat does not sit securely on the toilet seat. That creates a insecurity for the child who doesn't feel safe sitting on the toilet. The potty seat slips and slides which can create a small gap in the front through which urine will leak out.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat. The feet to help it stand are great for putting it on the back of the toilet tank or floor when not in use. It’s lightweight and easy to take from place to place while potty training. The handles definitely helped my son to feel more secure while getting used to the seat. The only thing I would change is the guard. It doesn’t come up high enough to block pee for boys. Unless he is seated just right he pees over the top. Even knowing that I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well fits well.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one we bought. We got rid of the first one after our kids were potty trained but had another baby and needed to potty train again. There are tons of seats like this. But we got this one again because it fits well on standard toilet seat. Its super durable and super washable for those nasty mistakes. Has handles on side so the baby can hold on while taking care of business. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kim

customer_reviews.title: Go design and great value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 to use on toto elongated toilet seats. They fit well ( see photo), and sit well for my 3 year old granddaughter. It has flanges on the sides that push down into the seat rim that makes it relatively stable. It seems that some reviewers think that it should lock in. Frankly I don’t think that would make any sense. It would have to be designed for too many types Of seat. This is easy on and easy off and easy to use. The two side handles are very handy for me to install and the child to grip. Good value for money. Rating A+!
customer_reviews.author: smithcover

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves this seat. He can put it on and off himself and he likes to hang onto the handles while he goes (gives him something to grab besides the toilet seat). It's easy to clean and stands upright to store which is very handy! Just bought a 2nd one so we don't have to try and remember which bathroom it's in. Also, this seat has a higher front than some other potty seats so it's helpful to block wild boy streams from hitting the floor.
customer_reviews.author: White Owl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit our toilet well at all
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this potty seat. The first time my husband helped my toddler onto it it fell partially in the toilet and splashed water everywhere, freaking out my toddler. We have a newer long oval shaped toilet and the seat doesn’t seem to be large enough to be safe. It is very light weight which I’m sure would be easy for travel but I wish I had paid a bit more to get a little larger, sturdier seat. Now I will have to buy a whole new one.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Cali

customer_reviews.title: A pain to unhook the potty seat from this
customer_reviews.text: The potty seat is a pain to unhook from this thing. If the neck of the part that hooks into the toilet tank were a solid material instead of flexible, it would be great. However, the neck of it is flexible so whenever you go to take the potty seat off of the hook, the whole thing catches. Not super friendly when trying to wrangle a potty training toddler with one hand and unhook the potty seat with the other.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean but slippery
customer_reviews.text: We got this to begin potty training our toddler. Overall, this was great fit as it fit over both a standard and nonstandard toilet. it's easy to clean and also lightweight (though still getting over packing a toilet in my travel bag LOL). the material is a little slippery for the baby's bum, so be careful to keep it as dry as well as possible as we had a few slippery accidents using this. overall happy with this and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: dryflytrout

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: We are potty training and I love these seats! They are easy to take on/off the toilet (so multiple people can use the bathroom). It’s easy to clean and works well for my 3 year old. I love that I don’t need to transfer human waste from a “little potty” to a regular toilet and flush. It all just goes in the regular toilet. I ended up buying two for upstairs and downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Holly P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect potty seat and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great seat for the price especially for a 2 year old. I looked at the seats with the ladders and the baby potties but honestly they are too expensive for beginners. My daughter was so proud and felt so accomplished to sit on this seat and the handles are perfect! It lets her feel confident and balance herself . I love this product I never thought potty training would be this easy. as long as your child is ready ( and every child is different) this is the perfect product for her at the perfect time.1
customer_reviews.author: Leann

customer_reviews.title: Basic design and very useful
customer_reviews.text: I have read and compare this product and other for sometimes. No regret to bought this one. It is very basic and worth the money. I bought this one for my 5 years old ( he is small) and my 16 months to slowly start potty train. My younger kid also be able to sit on this as well. One important thing I love about this is very easy to clean and self stand. It not eat up your space in your toilet. (my bathroom is kind of small).
customer_reviews.author: Krobiros

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat fair praice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2.5 year old who decided she no longer likes using her potty chair. I can wait with her in the bathroom patiently instead of bending my back while holding her over the toilet. I like that its fully plastic and white (easy to see any mess, and easy to disinfect every night). I also like the handles, because she holds them instead of touching the toilet. The only negative I have is that it does move easily while she's on it, which has scared her a few times, but its not possible for her to fall in.
customer_reviews.author: Adaobi Ujari

customer_reviews.title: Good seats
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these for out 2.5 year old to potty train. They are easy to use , even for him. They do not slip like other seats we tried on our oval toilets. I only wish they came with a hook to store them on the side of the toilet like other seats. I think these may be slightly uncomfortable for our son due to the splash guard. He seems to prefer another seat to these. But I think they are very good and well made for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend for boys but probably fine for a girl
customer_reviews.text: So overall this is ok, but it doesn’t seem to fit our more l oval shaped toilets as well and only really fits well in our toilet this is more circular then oval. Also compared to the other one we have i would not buy again or recommend for those training boys. The pee guard is so short and it doesn’t do nearly as much to help keep pee in the toilet as the other one we have with a much higher pee guard. If you have more circular toilets and are potty training a girl you’ll be good though.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't completely fill/cover the elongated opening, at least on ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't completely fill/cover the elongated opening, at least on our toilets, so there is a gap between this seat and the actual toilet seat in front if it is pushed all the way back. Little fingers can fit in and get pinched if the child shift around at the seat slides forward. Lip of the pee guard area could be a little softer (more rounded). Otherwise, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this seat
customer_reviews.text: We love this seat reducer, and so does our daughter. It fits the hole in the adult seat quite well (no rocking side to side), and has handles, which our baby intuitively grabs for balance. It's stable and comfortable. When not in use, we stand it up next to the toilet bowl or hang it on a hook we've attached to the flush tank. It's light and it's easy to clean. Really, what else could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Pippi Longshopping

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to try for the beginning of potty training. I like that it stands on end to take up a little less room without having to hamg it up in our small bathroom. It doesnt fit well on our round toilet so my 2 yr old needs help putting it on the toilet everytime one of her siblings uses the toilet. Seems to be holding up okay. Kept this for our downstairs bathroom but decided on a built in toddler chair to take up less room and fit better in our other bathroom
customer_reviews.author: MomOf4

customer_reviews.title: Kinda iffy product
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complicated just a potty seat it works ofcourse and it fits but it's completely bruised a ring around my son's butt he only sits up there for 5-10 minutes depending on what he has to do he's not huge or to big for the seat he's only 1 and he's 30 pounds we just got this product 3 days ago and in 3 days of potty training my son has a bruise ring on his butt maybe just go for a padded potty seat
customer_reviews.author: Connie Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: We needed this as our foster 4 year old boy didn't know how to potty and there was mess everywhere. Like other reviews say, this really doesn't fit all toilet seats. On ours, there was a space between this and toilet seat at front. Because of this mess still occurred if we don't tell him to aim down. It does have a pee guard at front but it's not perfect. On bottom side, it have some sharp corners and I guess it would be hard to clean if you don't rinse it right away and it dries.
customer_reviews.author: Dejan

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for the fit
customer_reviews.text: The handles on this seat are really awesome because it makes them feel more secure. But, it doesnt fit great on oval toilet seats. We make it work and it's still possible, but it's not the greatest- hence the 4 stars. But it has worked for us. It's also sturdy and well made...and I like the hook you can buy for it. Just be sure it's the munchkin brand. I bought a hook that was recommended with it and it was too big because it was a different brand and I had to go back and buy the correct one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ell

customer_reviews.title: It's ok and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Fits great on the toilet. My main gripe is that my 2 1/2 year touches all over the toilet with this as it inserts into the normal seat leaving parts of the seat exposed to the child. It's easy to drop on the toilet and remove. Easy to clean. And I could see it being easy to travel with. The handles don't let down so may be annoying in a suitcase...overall not bad...but I should've spent the extra money for the one he can step up on that covers the seat more.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit most toilets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it doesn’t fit our standard oval toilet. Brought it to my mothers to see if she could use it when she babysits and it fits her oval toilet but only towards the back with a gap between the front end of the toilet, leading to peepee messes when my daughter sits. Her legs can’t reach all the way over the toilet when this is in place. Will be returning as this is virtually useless on our standard oval toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ruotolo

customer_reviews.title: Toddler feels unsafe/Poor fit
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this does not fit our standard toilet seat at all. It slides all over the place because there is no grip, so it’s just smooth plastic on smooth plastic. This makes it very difficult and scary for our daughter to use, as she feels like every movement risks her falling off the toilet. We’re going to try to apply some sort of gripping/traction material to the underside to see if that solves the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: A perfectly fine basic seat
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this one instead of the one with the rubber "fitters" because we figured we might need to move it around from bathroom to bathroom. Despite that, it's easy to pick up/remove and set in place. Also, unless you really feel the need to buy the matching branded hooks, you can find alternatives for roughly half the price in any hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: meyerlane

customer_reviews.title: Fits elongated Toto toilet
customer_reviews.text: The best part of this seat that it's all one seamless construction. No crevices for pee to get stuck in like those soft seats with removable insert. I rinse it off in the sink after each use and do a more thorough scrub when cleaning the bathroom. The seat itself is smooth, no sharp plastic edges. Handles are very useful and a great design element. Fits our elongated Toto toilets and is easily portable. It also stands vertically on its own on the floor. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NEast

customer_reviews.title: Works for EC
customer_reviews.text: I've been implementing elimination communication since my son was about 2 months old, and now at 7 months, he's too big to hold so I needed a potty seat. This one has a small enough hole that his skinny butt doesn't fall through, which was my primary concern (not a chubby kid). He seems comfortable on it and no longer tries to push himself off, so win win! Also, the guard in the front is helpful for boy pee. Only mildly negative thing is that the plastic is a bit hard on his bottom (some red marks on his legs when I take him off), but it's probably no different from the marks you might get sitting on the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Bucknell

customer_reviews.title: To difficult to get seat on and off hook
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to get the potty seat on and off hook. Especially is you’re a toddler. Returning because my daughter would owe her pants before she would be able to get this seat off the hook and onto the toilet! Better off just setting the seat next to the toilet. The potty seat is awesome though!! We have an oval toilet and it fours great!
customer_reviews.author: James&Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and simple seat for the basic need.
customer_reviews.text: This seat is great! I love that it has handles and feet the stand it up on, when not in use. The only negative is that the center hole is a tad large, so my child's bottom kind of sags and she has to hold herself up while sitting on it. Fits my round toilet seat great, and a so-so fit on the elongated seat in our other bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Kate

customer_reviews.title: Best potty seat ever!
customer_reviews.text: Great design! Handles help our little guy place on the potty, it fits great once on the potty, and it has an elevated spray guard! Ya know...it's our first toddler and these are the things you don't think about when buying a potty training seat. My sister has 4 boys and was blown away by this design. Apparently most seats do not account for the male factor and pee goes everywhere and all over the toilet. Not with this awesome seat. Love that it can be hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Straight forward, simple to use toddler seat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toilet seat to introduce the idea of potty training to our toddler. It can be hung by a toilet hook (purchased separately) or can stand on its own. Placing it on the toilet is really easy—our toddler can do it themselves. Cleaning it doesn’t seem too challenging as long as you keep up on it. The place with the most “nooks/crannies” are underneath the handles. Another reason we purchased this toilet seat because it seems easy to travel with. Our toddler has yet to use the toilet seat for actually using the potty, but they like to place it on the ground, sit on it, and pretend to go potty. Overall, I’d recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Malley

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. I sent it back to amazon right away. This does not fit well on elongated toilets at all. I was afraid my son was going to fall everytime he tried to sit down. Also please please please do not buy this for a boy or you will be cleaning up pee all day long. The pee spout is not high enough to catch the pee. I ended up purchasing the Fischer price one and are much happier.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality and light weight. Easy to wipe down. Good fit for potty training. We're working with my granddaughter, I'm not sure that little hood at the front is high enough for a boy when they pee, but for a girl, it's perfect. Doesn't come with a hanger to put on the side of the toilet, but I had one from another potty seat I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Nassoiy

customer_reviews.title: ... fit well in my toilet (elongated) and I feel comfortable it won’t move around while my daughter is on ...
customer_reviews.text: This fit well in my toilet (elongated) and I feel comfortable it won’t move around while my daughter is on it. However, as it sits on an elongated toilet, there is a gap in the front, which is fine - but my daughter needs help to get up there. Otherwise, she is trying to scooch back on the toilet and the splash guard hurts her. She’s already preferring to just not use it unless I can help her on. Maybe that’s for the best for potty training purposes, but not so great for the product.
customer_reviews.author: CayDyl1021

customer_reviews.title: There are better options out there
customer_reviews.text: This while it may seem practical just didn't work for out toilet. It was never sturdy enough and did not fit our bowl properly. It also does not fold up whatsoever. There is a model that folds up super small for travel by other vendors that is superior for over a real toilet, or the mini toilets . Do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: LGB

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I do not like potty training. I do not like the portable potties because it is just gross to have to empty them and clean them. I have used portable seats such as this for all 3 of my children. When we were surprised with #4, I purchased this one. It fits both elongated and round seats. It's much easier to clean and more sanitary than a little potty. I like the fact it stands up on one end. That makes storage much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Medley

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit standard round toilet seat!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Does NOT fit a standard round toilet seat....only fits an oval seat! They should have written that in the description so it basically useless for my toddler grandchildren when they come to visit. Pros: Sturdy Easy to clean Would be great for travel providing all the seats you use are oval.
customer_reviews.author: evs

customer_reviews.title: Handles are a must
customer_reviews.text: This is cute and smaller than I thought but so perfect so it’s not taking up a lot of space. The handles are good and needed in my opinion because it helps my daughter hold on to something. Otherwise, she moves around too much and wants to get off. Very good quality and easy to clean and travel with if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jade A.

customer_reviews.title: Did I do something wrong?
customer_reviews.text: Is there something wrong with my toilet? I don't know. I thought I had this product with my son when he was little and it worked great - so i ordered the same one. This time it doesn't fit in our toilet seat, so not sure if I don't have a standard toilet seat size (whomp whomp, inferiority complex), or what's going on. So I can't really use it.....
customer_reviews.author: HumblePie78

customer_reviews.title: Good seat, but watch out for toilet size/fit
customer_reviews.text: This seat works just fine. However, it only fits 1 out of 3 of our toilets in the house. We have a couple different toilets in the house (all elongated bowls), and found that it only fit 1 of our toilets. Fortunately, we have a potty ladder on the main toilet (where this doesn't fit) and use this + stool for the extra toilet.
customer_reviews.author: iRenaissanceMan

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves using the real potty
customer_reviews.text: We finally trained our daughter to use a small potty but had decided it would be nice (during this pandemic) to also get her adjusted to using the real potty. We bought this and boom! She was so proud to use the actual potty and this worked great. It is lightweight and easy to just set on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Not boy friendly...
customer_reviews.text: I like it enough to keep it. The pee guard is too short for boys and thus made a mess EVERYWHERE. I have to clean pee after every use, but still an upgrade from the little toilet where i have to dump pee. Think theres a design flaw but it works. The positive is that this was a perfect fit on the toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: jek

customer_reviews.title: It serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: It’s great as it keeps the potty seat off the floor. My 2yo and 3yo does spend time trying to affix the seat to the hook. It’s great problem solving for them but I tried it myself and unless you have a spacious area surrounding your toilet it will require some maneuvering to get the seat on the hook.
customer_reviews.author: SachiKoKo

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came with the hanging hook
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to clean and you don’t have to worry about pee getting trapped anywhere in the seat. However it’s kind of annoying it doesn’t come with the hanging hook. Just seems like a money grab to have to purchase the hook separately. I would not bring this to a restaurant travel wise but maybe a hotel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't rest securely on toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: This did not work as well as I'd hoped. It doesn't rest securely on the toilet seat. Every time my toddler shifted on the seat, it would shift under him, causing him anxiety about using the potty. It isn't easy to take along when going places outside the home. It's easy to clean, but that's all to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Beulah

customer_reviews.title: the Munchkin Sturdy Potty Seat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the description and features listed. When I first placed the Munchkin Sturdy Potty Seat on the toilet I thought it was warped, then I noticed that it was not sturdy as described, just thin plastic that bends. The first time my 3 yr. old grandson tried to sit down it slipped off and he fell. He tried two more times and had issues trying to sit down before it slipped or tipped. He does not want to use the toilet with the Munchkin potty seat. For my standard round toilet this product does not grip or fit. I will have to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppertunist!

customer_reviews.title: Parents like it too
customer_reviews.text: I bought the seat so that it would be at my house when my twin grandkids were here. We could show them that it is just like (almost) the one they have at home. And that everybody has a potty in their house and they can use it. Their parents like it because it has handles on the sides for balance.
customer_reviews.author: history maven lady

customer_reviews.title: Not For Boys!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this seat three stars only because the splash guard for boys isn’t enough space. My son is only two however, the splash guard just isn’t big enough. It’s rather short in my opinion. I have to sit with him and hold his private part down because it just sticks up over the guard all together. Not convenient for potty training and for little guys that just don’t know what to do yet. If you are purchasing for a girl then perfect fit, good seat, easy to clean. But not ideal for boys.
customer_reviews.author: Eboni

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd training seat we have tried for my son who is 26 months old. He loves the handles for holding on while sitting. Falling through is not a worry with this seat, it fits great. it does slide/has some movement, you do have to hold the seat still while the child sits on, but then it's ok! We take it with us for travel use, works great!
customer_reviews.author: millennial_boymom

customer_reviews.title: My two year old can set it up
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the transition to the "big boy potty" for my son and he loved it. When we take him to the bathroom he runs in and sets it up and he's two so it very easy to use for the children. Its very easy to clean, there aren't any small holes or weird crevices. We do take it when we go to other people's homes but it isn't the best for going to stores.
customer_reviews.author: Tellessa

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for parents and toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as we started potty training my toddler, and have found them easy for both of us to use! We take this on and off the toilet as needed, and have taken it on trips. The handles are in a good spot for little hands to grip while sitting and the shape has fit all three of our toilets well, despite being different models. Would enthusiastically recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SaucyAmes

customer_reviews.title: Good little potty seat for small bums
customer_reviews.text: The seats fits our standard toilet with minimal rocking/looseness. Our son is about to potty train and has tested it out a few times to get comfortable with it; he really likes it. The little handles on the side seem to help him feel more secure since he has something to hold on to. The seat seems to be made of sturdy plastic and I wouldn’t be surprised if it lasted through all our kids (and future kids) potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Holly M.

customer_reviews.title: Only good for small kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 19 month old boy. Granted he’s 90th percentile height and weight, but the opening is tiny. I have to position him just right, and even then he’s pressed against the splash guard.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: We use this much more than our other ladder type seat we bought
customer_reviews.text: My son can take this on and off the toilet. It's our most used seat, even though we have another more expensive ladder type seat. We prefer this one, because he can assemble it and move it, plus using this with a small brick type step, my son can use the step at the faucet as well.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer hardisty

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat for toddler!
customer_reviews.text: It fits and sits very well on our toilets, it doesnt move around and my toddler is very comfortable using it! The splash guard is not perfect but as long as he pays attention to his seated position and adjusts before going then it does its job just fine. I could see how it might get really gross underneath but I've been rinsing it after each use and wiping it so it is still very clean! I just purchased two more - another one for the downstairs bathroom and an additional one for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly, works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: This seat fits our toilet seat (just a typical, soft close seat from a big box store) perfectly. It allows our kiddo to place it with ease, sit on it and hold the handles, and be able to look down to see if they are willing their bits to do their business. Everything you can need in a potty seat!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick and Christa

customer_reviews.title: It slides around
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the seat slides around and is not secure. It pinched my sons leg between the potty seat and toilet seat after sliding forward while he was trying to sit onto it. Needless to say my son does not want to sit on it anymore. I’m searching for a better solution. Would not recommend unless maybe you have a round toilet seat but I’m not even sure then it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Vernon

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t get again
customer_reviews.text: So if your toilet is right up against the wall, which most are, this won’t work well, it’s a good concept and for the price it’s a cheap lesson learned. installation is easy but when the seat goes on the hanger it hits up against the wall and also pushes out so when you lift the lid of the toilet seat it doesn’t go all the way back. Maybe I’m doing something wrong? Although there are very few ways this could be used and so I just don’t think it’s great for over the toilet use.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyB

customer_reviews.title: Better for my son
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used a soft ring years ago and I bought a boy soft ring for my son. I totally wasn't thinking this out obviously. No matter how often I cleaned it the thing stunk to high heavens! This fits my round toilet. It actually has a functional splash guard that is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Ech

customer_reviews.title: Clean and effective toilet training!!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is so much better than those floor pottys! Nothing to clean out, handles keep little hands off dirty seats, and the splash guard is a genius add! My son loves his new seat and I can throw out that nasty floor potty! If you’re potty training go for this one - it’s perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki Chic

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple seat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son and have no complaints. It's easy to use and takes up virtually no space. I also didn't have any issues with him peeing out of it like some of the previews reviewers. The first time he had a full bladder some pee did start to shoot out (since the little protector isn't that high) but i taught him to point it down with his fingers and he hasn't done it since.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: It sits a bit further back
customer_reviews.text: Since we live in a three story house, we got this and another one without the handles. My daughter does not like this one! The bowl opening is a little it smaller than the other one and it sits a bit further back. Whenever my daughter is using it, her legs can’t fold down at the knees so it’s a bit weird. Maybe when she’s a bit taller it would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Vietson N.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy - a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: We love that this seat is easy to move and store out of the way when adults need to use the washroom. It's easy to clean and takes up minimal space. The only downside is that my daughter has tipped out of it once or twice when she didn't get the seat securely in the larger toilet seat but thats operator error so I can't complain. We bought a second for our upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple potty ring
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a never ending battle with my little boy to potty train. I don't think the shield is quite high enough to be that effective but it's still better than another one we have where the shield won't stay attached. It's nice that it's all one piece and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Thayer

customer_reviews.title: May not fit all toilet seats.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t fit my particular toilet seat perfectly but I did got it on. Sort of. It doesn’t sit completely flushed to the toilet seat. If you push on it a little to the either side. It would pop off the seat easily. But it works fine for my daughter. She doesn’t seem to notice that it doesn’t fit perfectly and it’s comfortable for her. So it’s good enough for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mi

customer_reviews.title: Great seat but doesn’t fit a more ROUND toilet seats.
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 5 stars even though I had to return it. The seat was great quality and exactly what we were looking for (love the handles!!) - but it didn’t fit our toilet seat. Saw a lot of reviewers talking about how they fit standard seats and elongated seats - our seats are very round, this seat was just barely too long for ours. Very disappointed it didn’t work, haven’t found another seat (with handles) yet that will fit our round toilet seats.
customer_reviews.author: HolmesLyall

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take a lot of space, discreet, easy to use, good quality and good price! The only down side is that it moves a little bit when placed on top of the toilet seat, but very sturdy when the child is placed on it, so adult supervision while using it is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Corine

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for potty training. Works much better on our round toilet as opposed to the oblong one. Though I haven’t had issues with it not fitting on anything, it just fits better on the round one. Toddler seems to like it, no complaints from him. Super easy to wipe down both sides for cleaning. Easy to travel with to grandparents, vacation, friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good potty seat low pee guard
customer_reviews.text: The seat is overall pretty good. My son can sit on it comfortably. I wish the pee guard was a little higher. I just have to have him open his legs wide enough so he doesn’t make a mess. It slides a little bit on the toilet but not enough to fall off or cause any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as we begin our potty training journey with my son. It’s easy to put over our toilet seat. I’ve noticed he really likes the handles on either side and they allow him to feel more confident as he’s sitting on the big toilet. It’s also easy to clean. It’s definitely worth purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Just a round piece of plastic
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my standard toilet seat. It looks like it would be a pain to clean with all the compartments underneath, though. Terrible for traveling. It doesn't fold and I don't know anyone under 60 with a purse large enough to accommodate. Also, the front piece does not look like it would contain fluids for boys learning to use the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan J

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay potty seat. For both quality and fitting. It is not really fit on our toilets but still useable for our babies. The design is cute but quality is so so, not that great. It is easy to clean after used. Would get 5* if it fits our toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Pee...Everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: After one use I'm returning this seat. As soon as I set my son on it I could tell it probably wasn't going to work but figured I'd give it a shot. The pee guard is too short for boys and thus made a mess EVERYWHERE. The only positive is that this was a perfect fit on the toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: david laban

customer_reviews.title: Works Great For The Kids!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old and 2 year old use the potty seat comfortably and with ease. It fits in my standard toilet, however not in our master bath toilet as that is an oval shape. This potty seat is for more standard circular shaped toilet bowls. Otherwise, perfect addition!
customer_reviews.author: Stephie

customer_reviews.title: Using for 3 years & still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: These seats (2) were wonderful for potty training. My twins felt safe and secure using them almost from the start. The pee guard is a great feature, countless of saves from my little boy “misfires.” The only reason we still use it til this day is for comfort. The kiddos are still too small to sit comfortably on the regular sized toilets but even that is beginning to pass. Overall, it is sturdy & easy enough to clean, just leave them soaking in a cleanser for the little books and crannies then rinse & let dry.
customer_reviews.author: MGoose

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my parents house before we visited for a week. After that week I purchased two more to have at home when we arrived. At home we had the soft seats and this plastic one is soooo much better!! This one is so easy to clean! Plus the built in protector for little boys who sometimes forget to keep pee in the toilet is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: bridgetb

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this my two year old son always wanted to hop on the toilet like a big boy to handle his business. He could care less about the miniature toilet we bought for him. This solved all our problems. Perfect size for our toilet seat as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gamez

customer_reviews.title: Super small opening
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these hoping to get rid of the bigger and uglier seats. But the hole is super small so my little guy has trouble getting comfortable on the seat. It also didnt fit the round seat we have in the upstairs bathroom. Womp Womp.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Wykowski

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all round seats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help my toddler transition from the potty chair to the big boy toilet. Fits my round toilet seat perfect. Took it to my parent's and it does not fit in their round seat. It does what I bought it for and am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cash

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to Bjorn seat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a secondary/cheaper option for our upstairs toilet. We also have a bjorn one. This is easily the second best/cheaper alternative to The Bjorn seat. Not as stable, but very good buy for the price. It’s also a smaller one that will fit a smaller, round toilet bowl/seat. Not as easy to clean and my son loves the handles!
customer_reviews.author: LoveDsign

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic seat.
customer_reviews.text: Super great seat to take with on travel, while potty training or if you are kind of a germaphobe & don't want your child sitting on public restroom seats (like me 😬). I've been a lot of places and it hasn't fit on 2 seats we encountered but I'm glad he was still able to sit on something. Only downfall, it's a little bulky to totes around.
customer_reviews.author: LUIS GONZALEZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect potty seat for training. It’s lightweight and good for traveling. Easy to clean, everything wipes off. It has fit every toilet we’ve ever used it with. Handles on the sides make it more comfortable for kids to hold on to and feel stable. My two year old figured out how to put it on the toilet herself. It’s a good size for both very young (we started at 16 months old) and older toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this to arrive, once I set it up and stuck the Munchkin potty seat on the hook, I realized it was not very easy to actually use. It takes some wiggling and adjusting to get the hook in the opening, my toddler cannot do it on his own. I was definitely let down, good concept here but needs work.
customer_reviews.author: Ashcuad

customer_reviews.title: Simple and is not ugly
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid this would be super ugly but its really not bad. We keep it close to the toilet for our daughter and us to quickly grab when she needs it. I like how well it sits in the seat and I feel its safe and secure. The handles are nice for even our 17 month old to hold on without us being right on top of her. I would recommend this to anyone looking for something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rought

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: This was not effective for us. We quickly replaced it with a stand-alone potty for my toddler that's much closer to the ground. This potty seat made my child so uncomfortable. He was scared to be up so high, and he couldn't get on or off by himself. It also doesn't sit in the toilet very securely, so it would jolt when I placed my toddler on top, which just scared him more. I had been hoping that this product would work for us, given that it's small and removable and doesn't require cleaning poo out of a separate potty. But alas, a separate potty proved necessary for us.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Gunkler

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. I have 2 toddlers who are potty trained but still need a little support on the toilet. I was so thankful to be able to toss the small potty and stick with this. It sits secure and my boys are very comfortable on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small bathroom and didn’t have enough room for a seat with an attached stool. This works great, and is easy to clean. We have a separate step stool that we can move between the toilet and sink and then put out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: J

product_meta.title: Munchkin Sturdy Potty Seat, Green
product_meta.description:
Color:GreenCalm your little one's fears of falling in the big toilet with Munchkin's Sturdy Potty Seat. The easy to clean potty seat fits most standard toilets and is contoured to hold your child securely in place. Easy grip handles add stability and a non skid edge prevents the seat from moving around giving your little one more confidence when navigating tricky new waters. Also included are a built in pee guard and "feet" for easy stand up storage. You will no longer toil through toilet training with this comfortable potty seat.

BRAND STORY
By Munchkin
feature_bullets: Portable toddler potty seat perfect for potty training boys and girls
Contoured to hold child securely in place
Non skid edge ensures that seat doesn't move
Built in handles for added security
"Feet" for easy stand up storage; Material: Plastic

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,258 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
